schema.description: A layer that performs spatial convolution or deconvolution.

attributes.name: outputShape
attributes.description: Either None or a 2-tuple, specifying the output shape (output_height, output_width). Used only when is_deconv == True. When is_deconv == False, this parameter is ignored. If it is None, the output shape is calculated automatically using the border_mode. Kindly refer to NeuralNetwork.proto for details.

attributes.name: outputChannels
attributes.description: The number of kernels. Same as ``C_out`` used in the layer description.

attributes.name: kernelChannels
attributes.description: Channel dimension of the kernels. Must be equal to ``inputChannels / nGroups``, if isDeconvolution == False. Must be equal to ``inputChannels``, if isDeconvolution == True.

attributes.name: nGroups
attributes.description: Group convolution, i.e. weight reuse along channel axis. Input and kernels are divided into g groups and convolution / deconvolution is applied within the groups independently. If not set or 0, it is set to the default value 1.

attributes.name: isDeconvolution
attributes.description: lag to specify whether it is a deconvolution layer.

schema.description: A layer that performs a matrix vector product. This is equivalent to a fully-connected, or dense layer.
Gated-Recurrent Unit (GRU) Layer
A unidirectional long short-term memory (LSTM) layer.
Bidirectional long short-term memory (LSTM) layer. The first LSTM operates on the input sequence in the forward direction. The second LSTM operates on the input sequence in the reverse direction.
A layer that performs elementwise addition of a bias, which is broadcasted to match the input shape.
Applies specified type of activation function to input.
A layer that performs softmax normalization. Normalization is done along the channel axis.
A layer that performs batch normalization, which is performed along the channel axis, and repeated along the other axes, if present.
A layer that performs L2 normalization, i.e. divides by the the square root of the sum of squares of all elements of input.
A layer that performs local response normalization (LRN).
Spatial Pooling layer to reduce dimensions of input using the specified kernel size and type.
A layer that rearranges the dimensions and data of an input.
A layer that reduces the input using a specified operation.
A layer that flattens the input.
A layer that recasts the input into a new shape.
A layer that reorganizes data in the input in: 1. SPACE_TO_DEPTH, 2. DEPTH_TO_SPACE.
Fill a constant value in the padded region.
A layer that crops the spatial dimensions of an input. If two inputs are provided, the shape of the second input is used as the reference shape.
A layer that repeats a sequence.
A layer that concatenates along the channel axis (default) or sequence axis.
A layer that performs elementwise addition.
A layer that performs elementwise multiplication.
A layer that computes the elementwise maximum over the inputs.
A layer that computes the elementwise minimum over the inputs.
A layer that computes the elementwise average of the inputs.
A layer that applies a unary function.
Fill a constant value in the padded region.
If true, inputs are normalized first, thereby computing the cosine similarity.
A layer that performs elmentwise multiplication by a scale factor and optionally adds a bias.
A layer that scales up spatial dimensions. It supports two modes: nearest neighbour (default) and bilinear.
A layer that slices the input data along a given axis.
A layer that uniformly splits across the channel dimension to produce a specified number of outputs.
A layer that performs a matrix lookup and optionally adds a bias.
